info.criteria: Legitimate user Debbie clicked and executed malicious self-extracting archive (Resume Viewer.exe) on 10.0.1.6 (Nimda)
info.note: Telemetry showed execution of Resume Viewer.exe.

info.criteria: Previously executed batch file (pdfhelper.cmd) launched a DLL payload (update.dat) using Rundll32
info.note: Telemetry showed cmd.exe launching rundll32.exe.

info.criteria: Cobalt Strike: Built-in process injection capability executed to inject callback into cmd.exe
info.note: Telemetry showed powershell.exe creating a remote thread into cmd.exe.

info.criteria: Cobalt Strike: 'schtasks' via cmd to create scheduled task that executes a DLL payload (updater.dll)
info.note: Telemetry showed the execution of schtasks.exe as well as the full command-line arguments.

info.criteria: Scheduled task executed when user Debbie logs on to Nimda (10.0.1.6), launching a DLL payload (updater.dll) using Rundll32
info.note: Telemetry showed rundll32.exe executing updater.dll.

info.criteria: Legitimate user Bob clicked and executed malicious VBScript (autoupdate.vbs) on 10.0.1.5 (CodeRed)
info.note: Telemetry showed wscript.exe executing autoupdate.vbs and the subsequent PowerShell child process.

info.criteria: Empire: Built-in WinEnum module executed to programmatically execute a series of enumeration techniques
info.note: Telemetry showed PowerShell running and a PowerShell script being written to disk that coincided with the execution of WinEnum.

info.criteria: Empire: Built-in runas module executed to launch malicious VBScript (autoupdate.vbs) as user Kmitnick
info.note: Telemetry showed cmd.exe executing autoupdate.vbs via wscript.exe as user Kmitnick

info.criteria: Empire: 'sc start' via PowerShell to remotely launch a specific service on Creeper (10.0.0.4)
info.note: Telemetry showed execution of sc.exe to start the AdobeUpdater service on 10.0.0.4 (Creeper). Telemetry on Creeper showed the execution of cmd.exe to run update.vbs.

info.criteria: Previously executed batch file (pdfhelper.cmd) moved a separate batch file (autoupdate.bat) to the Startup folder
info.note: Telemetry showed a cmd.exe \"rename to executable\" event for autoupdate.bat in the Startup folder.

info.criteria: Batch file (autoupdate.bat) previously written to Startup folder executed when user Debbie logs on to Nimda (10.0.1.6), launching a DLL payload (update.dat) using Rundll32
info.note: Telemetry showed cmd.exe executing autoupdate.bat from the Startup folder.

info.criteria: RDP connection to Conficker (10.0.0.5) authenticated using previously added user Jesse
info.note: Telemetry showed \\"unregmp2.exe /FirstLogon\\" (associated with user logon) as well as the user name \\"Jesse J\\" within Machine Properties.

info.criteria: Empire: 'copy' via PowerShell to overwrite magnify.exe with cmd.exe
info.note: Telemetry showed a file write event on magnify.exe in the system directory. A search for \"cmd\" on CodeRed shows the hash value of magnify.exe matches cmd.exe.

info.criteria: magnifer.exe previously overwritten by cmd.exe launched through RDP connection made to Creeper (10.0.0.4)
info.note: Telemetry showed execution of magnify.exe.

info.criteria: Cobalt Strike: C2 channel modified to use port 80
info.note: Telemetry showed connections over TCP port 80 to freegoogleadsenseinfo.com (C2 domain).

info.criteria: Empire: UAC bypass module downloaded a new Empire stager (wdbypass) over port 8080
info.note: Telemetry showed network connection to 192.168.0.5 (C2 server) over port 8080. Though it does not count as a detection, telemetry also showed an encoded PowerShell command that could be decoded outside the capability to show the IEX command used to download the file (wdbypass) over HTTP port 8080.

info.criteria: Cobalt Strike: Built-in upload capability executed to write a DLL payload (updater.dll) to disk on Nimda (10.0.1.6)
info.note: Telemetry showed file write of updater.dll.

info.criteria: Empire: Built-in upload module executed to write malicious VBScript (autoupdate.vbs) to disk on CodeRed (10.0.1.5)
info.note: Telemetry showed file write of autoupdate.vbs.

info.criteria: Empire: Built-in upload module executed to write binary (recycler.exe) to disk on CodeRed (10.0.1.5)
info.note: Telemetry showed a write file event for recycler.exe.

info.criteria: Empire: C2 channel established using HTTPS traffic to freegoogleadsenseinfo.com
info.note: Telemetry showed powershell.exe making a connection over port 443 to freegoogleadsenseinfo.com (C2 domain).

info.criteria: Cobalt Strike: C2 channel modified to proxy RDP connection to Conficker (10.0.0.5)
info.note: Telemetry showed cmd.exe connecting to 10.0.0.5 (Conficker) over port 3389.

info.criteria: Empire: Brute force password spraying attempts targeted Windows admin shares on Morris (10.0.1.4) and Nimda (10.0.1.6)
info.note: Telemetry showed repeated logon attempts targeting ADMIN$ via net.exe and command-line arguments.

info.criteria: Empire: Successful authentication targeted Windows admin share on Conficker (10.0.0.5)
info.note: Telemetry showed a logon attempt via net.exe and command-line arguments targeting ADMIN$ via net.exe and command-line arguments.

info.criteria: Empire: Successful authentication targeted Windows admin shares on Conficker (10.0.0.5)
info.note: Telemetry showed a logon attempt via net.exe and command-line arguments targeting C$ via net.exe and command-line arguments.

info.criteria: Empire: 'net use' via PowerShell to brute force password spraying authentication attempts to Morris (10.0.1.4) and Nimda (10.0.1.6) targeting credentials of usersKmitnick, Bob, and Frieda
info.note: Telemetry showed repeated logon attempts via net.exe and command-line arguments indicative of password spraying.

info.criteria: Empire: Successful authentication to Conficker (10.0.0.5) using credentials of user Kmitnick as a result of the brute force password spraying
info.note: Telemetry showed repeated logon attempts via net.exe and command-line arguments indicative of password spraying, eventually resulting in a successful logon.

info.criteria: Empire: 'net use' via PowerShell to successfully authenticate to Conficker (10.0.0.5) using credentials of user Kmitnick
info.note: Telemetry showed a logon attempt via net.exe and command-line arguments using valid credentials of user Kmitnick.

info.criteria: Empire: 'sc create' via PowerShell to remotely create a service on Creeper (10.0.0.4)
info.note: Telemetry showed execution of sc.exe to create a new service called AdobeUpdater with a binPath set to run cmd.exe and execute update.vbs.

info.criteria: Empire: 'net use -delete' via PowerShell
info.note: Telemetry showed net.exe execution and command-line arguments.

info.criteria: Empire: 'sc description' via PowerShell to remotely disguise a service on Creeper (10.0.0.4)
info.note: Telemetry showed execution of sc.exe to create a new service called AdobeUpdater with a binPath set to run cmd.exe and execute update.vbs as well as set the service description. An analyst can use this information to determine the service is masquerading.

info.criteria: Empire: 'takeown' via PowerShell to obtain ownership of magnify.exe
info.note: Telemetry showed takeown.exe execution to change the file permissions on magnify.exe.

info.criteria: Empire: 'icacls' via PowerShell to modify the DACL for magnify.exe
info.note: Telemetry showed icacls.exe execution to change permissions on magnify.exe granting discretionary access to SYSTEM.

info.criteria: Empire: Executed binary (recycler.exe) is a renamed copy of the WinRAR binary
info.note: Telemetry showed execution of recycler.exe with full command-line arguments, including -hp flag, indicating compression and encryption was used with a WinRAR utility.

info.criteria: Empire: 'net use' via PowerShell to successfully authenticate to Creeper (10.0.0.4) using credentials of user Kmitnick
info.note: Telemetry showed a process tree containing a logon attempt via net.exe and command-line arguments using valid credentials of user Kmitnick.

info.criteria: Empire: Executed binary (recycler.exe) created compressed archive (old.rar) of previously collected file
info.note: Telemetry showed execution of recycler.exe with full command-line arguments, including -hp flag, indicating compression and encryption was used with a WinRAR utility.

info.criteria: Empire: Executed binary (recycler.exe) created encrypted archive (old.rar) of previously collected file
info.note: Telemetry showed execution of recycler.exe with full command-line arguments, including -hp flag, indicating compression and encryption was used with a WinRAR utility.

info.criteria: Empire: Sequence of 'echo' commands via PowerShell to populate commands in text file (ftp.txt), which is then executed by FTP to exfil data through network connection separate of existing C2 channel
info.note: Telemetry showed the execution of ftp.exe with command-line arguments, including ftp.txt, for exfiltration. The contents of ftp.txt was not seen.
